main_definition: Failing refers to the act of not succeeding or falling short in achieving a goal, standard, or expectation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not being successful in an endeavor
meanings_and_examples.example: The student was failing his math class due to poor grades.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A business that is not doing well financially and may be at risk of closure
meanings_and_examples.example: Many stores on Main Street are now failing, struggling to stay afloat amidst the economic downturn.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The process or act of letting go of a plant from which it is not possible to save through proper care and treatment
meanings_and_examples.example: Due to severe drought conditions, the gardener had no choice but to fail the plants in his garden.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A test used by lenders or landlords to determine if a borrower can afford to take on debt
meanings_and_examples.example: When applying for a mortgage, I knew that my credit score and income would be scrutinized during the approval process.
